result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Morales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel M Morales is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel M Morales was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Harm Reputation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(c).
  • Daniel M Morales was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Harm Reputation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(c).
  • Daniel M Morales was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 365 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of extended supervision, before costs or fines, for Unemployment/Workforce Development.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Extradition costs to be paid for the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office, to be paid before costs or fees.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to use or possess anyone else's personal identifying information or financial information.
No contact with victim listed in criminal complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom
Defendant Daniel M Morales in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
COUNT:  1
Total Prison: 2 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1 Year
Extended Supervision: 1 Year
365 Days Credit.

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Not to use or possess any else's personal indentification information or financial information.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with:  victim listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

EXTRADITION COSTS:  $2,763.90 (to be paid To the Waukesha County District Attorney's Office - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
RESTITUTION:  $3,630 (to be paid to Unemployment/Workforce Development - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $ 268
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

09:23 AM Defendant Daniel M Morales in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay who appeared by Zoom Video.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint.  The defendant is asking to speak to Attorney Kay in person prior to waiving the preliminary hearing as he has additional questions.  Court notes the State's witness did appear today.  The Court will set this matter over for a preliminary hearing next week.  Court will hold onto the preliminary waiver that was previously filed and address it at the next hearing depending on whether or not the defense intends on waiving the preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2020 at 10:00 am.
